39401198.review: Great little 2 hour puzzler.  Level 57 drove me nuts.  The rest were quite manageable.  Nice flow and great music.

39359608.review:
Short, but fun and worth the price.

In some puzzle games you play around on each level until you figure it out.  In others, you sit at the beginning of the level and plan for awhile before you do anything.  For me, this game was mostly the latter.  The first forty or so levels where pretty quick and easy.  The last twenty were more complicated and required more thought.  Overall, I'd say that, by the end, the game was moderately difficult and that's probably good because if they had made it too much more complicated, I think it would have taken longer for each level, but not really have been more fun.

So, all in all, I enjoyed it and recommend it.

39215480.review: In ca. 90 Minuten zwar durchgespielt, aber macht viel Spaß. Wer ein kleines Knobelspiel sucht findet hier ein kurzes, aber gutes, Spiel für wenig Geld.

This is a rather unique yet rather simple puzzle game and was really relaxing in a way. The puzzles the futhur you got in required a little more thought.

Don't play puzzle games all too much? Give it a try, you'll like the first handful but if you're like me the last few especially try to distract you but you'll get it. 
Great yet simple graphics - worth the price.

38929943.review: I so very much liked this game. At first I thought it was going to be a Hooks copycat, but it turned out to be its own game, with its own mechanics. 60 levels. Very relaxing. Even the music soothes (this is the first minimalist game where I kept the music on, the whole time). Took me three hours to complete. I very much hope there will be a second game, as the mechanic with pulling the hooks back and forth could be explored much further.

38928643.review: Although I initially was skeptical about this game because of it's similarities to another puzzle game called Hook, the one thing that makes it different is there are balls you have to "sink" similar to a sinker on a fishing line, in an empty shell kind of thing. Despite me Hook more challenging and enjoyable than SiNKR, this is still a great minimalist puzzle game that's pretty easy to finish obtain 100% of the achievements.

38874637.review:
yet another single-buck minimalist puzzle game, reminiscent of the excellent [b]hook[/b], then it introduces [b]hade[/b]-like elements, then portals. the 60 levels should take about an hour or two to complete, but from around 40 a few require timing to pull things off. wasn't expecting that, so I can't whole-heartedly recommend it, but it's pretty cool otherwise, the music and sound effects complement each other well and there are separate volume sliders for them. no undo button, the game wasn't designed with that in mind, but it's not really necessary. the aesthetics are nice too, except the 3d objects floating in the background, which you can turn off. I think it's a worthy addition to one's puzzle collection.

(edited because volume sliders are in the game now)

38726090.review:
Классная головоломка. Изящная. Ни на что не похожая. Приятная музыка. Приятный фон и окружение. 60 уровней. 100 минут на прохождение ушло у меня. И в то же время совсем легкой ее не назовешь, особенно последние 5-10 уровней. 
9 достижений выполняются по ходу + 10е достижение вы вероятнее всего получите сразу))) В общем 100% без проблем.

38678125.review:
A quick and rewarding puzzler with some good ideas.

It can be a little unnerving jumping into a few of the more intimidating levels but just testing things out leads to getting an idea of how things work together. Watching your plan come to life while watching shapes slide into their places is pleasant.

Almost certain that some of the final puzzles can be solved multiple ways. Regardless if that's true, it adds some freeform that pays off the beginning’s slower 'one-solution' puzzles. [spoiler] Level #58 might’ve been a little too freeform, had some trouble with that one [/spoiler].

The only really threatening mechanic was the [spoiler] gear you could choose the next direction of manually. Its introduction seemed to foreshadow crazy puzzles involving planning several steps ahead. Thankfully, they don't cause too much of a disturbance as their importance diminished quickly but at the same time this feels like a small waste  [/spoiler]

Recommend grabbing this game (or others like it), turning off the music and sfx and just throwing some personal audio in the background. Makes for a great cool down :)

38634952.review: Great puzzle game for the price (less than a dollar). 60 levels that aren't too easy or too challenging. Very fun and relaxing but the last 5 puzzles actually get kinda difficult. Highly recommend.

38580436.review:
This is a great puzzle game.

+ Simple Rules for how objects interact
+ Complex situations when you combine the different rules
+ Requires you to think out a solution, or you could do it through trial and error. I prefer to think it through fully before executing, but being able to experiment is useful in some of the puzzles
+ Had a few puzzles that stumped me temporarily
+ Has very busy graphics, but you can turn it down to suit your preference

A downside though:

- Plenty of levels, but maybe not enough. Some sort of a workshop-based system where users could submit custom levels might be nice

38570027.review:
60关，最后3关需要思考下，其余纯休闲，还不赖，个人喜欢这种不太烧脑的小游戏
音乐也不吵人，能很放松的玩

38545656.review:
[h1]SiNKR ▸Écrit[/h1]

Reposant, c’est le terme. Enfin du moins au début. SiNKR fait parti de ces petits jeux pas chers qui sauront vous faire réfléchir sans vous frustrer et ce dans une ambiance posée. 

Commençant tout en douceur avec un crochet et deux ronds ; l’un est vide tandis que l’autre est plein, que doit-on faire ? Simple, et si l’on utilisait ce crochet pour ramener le rond plein dans le rond vite.

Voilà en peu de mot le principe de SiNKR. Tout du long de son expérience, le joueur va rencontrer des situations de plus en plus ardues mais pour autant pas désespérantes ni frustrantes. Des éléments de gameplay vont ainsi être ajouté les uns après les autres et le joueur devra les appréhender. Au début ce ne seront que des ajouts minimes comme des cubes vides et pleins suivant le même principe que les ronds. Et puis le titre va se corser petit à petit, ajoutant des sortes de catapultes sous la forme de flèches, des portails,... 

Le jeu n’offre qu’une durée assez limité mais l’agencement de la difficulté et les éléments de gameplay apportés sont intéressants et dans un ordre cohérent. Rajoutant des versions alternatives de chacun des éléments et permettant même de contrôler plus amplement certains d’entre eux, notamment les portails.

C’est à dire que SiNKR est un petit jeu auquel vous pouvez jouer pour vous détendre mais aussi pour réfléchir et ceci sans se prendre trop la tête. 

[quote] Vous pouvez suivre la page curateur ici : [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/28282773/] Sacrez'Art[/url][/quote]

38498203.review: This one was a lot of fun.  At times super difficult but lots of "Wow! Why didn't I see that?" moments.  Music is nice too.  I haven't quite finished, due to the holidays, but got all the way to level 46 so not too bad.  I'll finish it after the holidays.  Definitely makes you think and plan ahead.

38435411.review: Pomysł fajny, ciekawe rozwiązania. Jedyny mankament to fakt, że gra jest krótka.

38330811.review: Great game!  Towards end got really sweet!

38239643.review:
中规中矩的解谜游戏，就是用钩子抓小球，使特定形状的小球运动到特定位置
随着关卡的深入，逐渐增加了改变方向的机关、传送门等机关，有几关还是要稍微想下的
不能撤销前面的操作稍微有点讨厌，一旦有操作错误就要重来，不过好在每一关的流程都还算简单
通关需要的时间不长，大概2-3小时，通关就能全成就，成就党的福音，暂且给个7/10吧

38214163.review:
SiNKR is inspired by simple indie puzzle games like Hook, but it pushes the concept a lot further. Unlike some of those indie puzzle games where you can't really make a mistake (all you have to do is find the piece that moves and move it, then find the next one), in SiNKR you really have to think to find out in which order to move which piece to end up with all the right pieces at the right places.

The puzzles are well designed and it has a nice progression in difficulty, with many new concepts added along the way. The game isn't long, it took me about an hour to complete, but for the price it's definitely worth it!

38162332.review:
The pros are the new mechanic and most of all clever puzzles, that make you think - definetely good work was put into it.
The con is however a strong one, at least for me. I didn't find it pleasing, and for a puzzle game this is important. Compare this to the Push game, where you can get an orgasm just pushing the buttons, let alone the mega click-click-click solving a level. And here, well, this part was left with a pretty low priority.

I still recomend this, because of interesting puzzles, and to encourage a promising developer, but be warned.

37836424.review: The first half of this game is reasonably well design although not truly challenging. As the game progresses, the apparent effort going into level design dwindles to practically nothing. By the final chapter, the creator has dropped all pretense of crafting actual puzzles, and some of the final levels can be cleared just by pushing the most obvious button.

37532508.review:
SiNKR is nicely designed, and sounds good, but the puzzles are a bit repetetive, and mostly consist of trial and error, rathe than real puzzling. Also there is no narrative, which is always rough for me to enjoy. If you're really into trying out a new type of neat puzzle, give it a shot. Hard to beat for a dollar, but I won't recommend it specifically.

Also: It could really use an 'undo last step' button. Having to startthe whole puzzle over when making a wrong click is frustrating on the more complex levels.

Biorąc pod uwagę cenę polecam nie zastanawiać się zbyt długo, tylko brać i grać! :)

Like all great games, SiNKR's simplicity can mislead you to thinking this game is 'easy'. As the combinations and components increase the possibilities and scope expands exponentially.

I crave more, more achievements, more levels, just MORE SiNKR!

[It would be great to be able to submit 'fan levels' by some means. This is how much I love it.]

36692598.review: A good 1$ minimalist puzzle game with 60 levels, around 2h long. If you like this kind (like Hook, Zenge, etc..) you won't be disappointed, there are achievements, relaxing music and the game is polished. The only downside is that the graphic design is not very obvious for the brain, for instance what is clickable does not differentiate enough from what is not clickable, also some levels can looks confusing at first glance and be easy in reality, but we can forgive these flaws because the level design is interesting and it has an overall well calibrated level of difficulty. 7/10

36600122.review:
What can I say that's not already been said?  The game has a very simple design, and absolutely NO INSTRUCTIONS.  That's not a bad thing, because you are thrust into puzzle after puzzle and have to figure out how things work.  Sometimes they don't work exactly as you expect; that's part of the game.  Figuring things out.  Learning by trying.  Clicking things and seeing what happens.  Some levels introduce new mechanics, and then the next levels put them together with what you already know in strange and unexpected ways.

The main joy for Me in this game (and in life) is figuring things out.  There seem to be some videos on YouTube showing exactly how to play the game and get through every puzzle.  I didn't watch any of them and downvoted the link to them on Steam.  I certainly don't recommend them to anyone.  But I guess if you're just an achievement wrhoe who doesn't care about actually achieving anything in real life, those videos could be handy.

It is completely mouse-constrolled; I don't think I touched the keyboard at all during the game.  As I said, there are NO INSTRUCTIONS.  The icons in the game menus aren't even labeled.  They are, for the most part, pretty obvious -- but sometimes you do what you do in the game: click and see what happens.

The game offers very little replay value for people without Alzheimer's.  However, it could be enjoyable to come back to every now and then to relax and keep your mind sharp.  The music is nice, the background is pretty, and the sound effects aren't jarring.  For the price, this game is outstanding.  The author appears to be very active in the forums and quite responsive to customer problems.  And perhaps most importantly of all for someone like Me, it's available on Linux.

10/10 - hopefully the author will write some more levels for the game eventually.

--V

36581781.review: SiNKR is a relaxing puzzle game. The game progresses in difficulty fairly smoothly and each new mechanic is presented in an intuitive way. The music is relaxing, and the piano sounds for each interaction object are nice and clearly let you know if anything is going on where you are not looking.

36581060.review: There aren't enough games like SiNKR out there. The puzzles are beautifully designed in such a way that they teach you the game without any text being needed. What I like most is how the levels organically scale in complexity by introducing each new puzzle element in its own sort of demo level, then layering them on top of elements you've previously encountered to build more advanced puzzles without it ever feeling unnatural or confusing. My only negative comment is that the game seems a bit unstable, as I did and counter a few crashes while playing through it. Apart from that I have only good things to say about this game!

36509368.review:
SiNKR by developer Robert Wahler constitutes a good minimalist puzzle game. From truly great level designs to soothing music scores, SiNKR excels at incorporating the constituent elements of its genre into the fabric of its gameplay. Offering a relaxed experience with no timers or move counters, SiNKR allows players to lavish their full attention onto the puzzle facing them. SiNKR also nails the difficulty progression of its levels, starting out slow but quickly working its way to simultaneously being complicated and fun. At its current price of $1, SiNKR is a great value and is definitely worth playing.

SiNKR opens very slowly, allowing players time to adjust to the game’s mechanics. The gameplay is revealed to center around moving pucks into holes using hooks. The hooks only move in one direction and cannot return to their original positions once they have been reeled in close to the holes, which serves as the operative limiting factor that makes the game challenging. Some holes take more than one puck to fill, while all hooks are able to collect more than one puck at any given moment. While those with completionist tendencies do not need to worry about succeeding in a certain finite number of moves, all players must be strategic or else they will have to redo the puzzles.

The aspect of the puzzler that really shines is its great, handcrafted level design. SiNKR really succeeds in striking a balance between stimulating and frustrating players. Whenever players figure out a creative solution to a level, they are immediately gratified by the effort that they put in. SiNKR feels smart and really encourages exploration within its individual levels.

The game mechanics become more sophisticated as players progress through the levels. While they begin by just being able to pull on hooks, soon players gain the abilities to horizontally or vertically flip the side of the hook and to connect hooks together. Linking hooks allows players to advance their hooks to parts of the levels previously inaccessible due to their original positioning, adding initially unexpected flavor to SiNKR. The game never allows for a mechanic to become stale or monotonous, instead introducing new ones before players have the chance to grow disinterested.

The music that is played in the background of each level really enhances the gaming experience. It encapsulates the tranquil yet thought-provoking feel that is at the essence of the SiNKR. The ambient music fits perfectly with the niche that SiNKR fills, really elevating the game.

Even though SiNKR only takes between one and two hours to complete, it is really worth investing in. The thought put into each level is readily apparent, making players utilize visual as opposed to textual learning to become accustomed to new gameplay mechanics. Full controller support and touch screen compatibility only further enhance a great game. SiNKR is worth picking up, and that is reflected in its score of 8/10.

Rating: 8/10

36501550.review: Glad to have Sinkr on my laptop/tablet. It's smooth, peaceful, and serene. Works nice with the touch screen or mouse pad. I definitely recommend this game if you like puzzles and games like Unblock Me. The game helps you to relax. You just sit back and think about how to use the hooks to manuever the discs into the circles. Nice, simple, chill game.  The levels of course increase in difficulty and that keeps you playing.

36462400.review: Nice little puzzle game with good aesthetics. Would have liked it to be longer, but for a dollar it's hard to complain.

36424584.review: Great little puzzle game with a relaxing atmosphere and approachable mechanics.  Nails the minimalism while having a silky smooth progression and avoiding becoming too overwhelming in the later levels.  I highly recommend SiNKR for times when you just want to sit back, relax, and solve a few puzzles.

36355301.review:
This is a quality minimalist puzzle game. It has about 60 levels with increasing level of challenge as you progress. I count 5 distinct mechanics with some variations on display here which is a very generous amount considering the game's low price. What I like about the mechanics is the fact that base mechanics are simple and easy to understand but the game builds on them to gradually roll out increasingly complex situations. It uses visual learning with no text when introducing new mechancics which I think is a very good way to do it. The puzzles are not too hard but are challenging enough to feel like an accomplishment when you solve them.

In terms of other aspects, the game was stable for me and I didn't enconter any glitches. I thought that the level of graphics was adequate for a minimalist puzzle game. The loading time was a little too long when you first start the game but not excessively so.

36231970.review: "This is well designed". I just kept saying that over and over again as I completed each level. This is SO well designed. You can tell the developer sat down and planned out every single level on paper because THEY ARE SO WELL DESIGNED. This game needs more attention, and I hope more people discover this unique puzzle game gem.

36228023.review: 1-2 hours of great chill gameplay, probably more if you stretch it out over multiple sessions, it's a steal for the price. Try it out. No crazy time or # of clicks achievements leaving the completionists feeling like they are missing something, it really lends itself to a relaxing, thoughtful pace.

36175796.review:
Solid and relaxing puzzle
hook line and sinkr

36162339.review:

36150675.review:
A la question "[i]Peut-on considérer que [i][b]Sinkr[/b][/i] est bien-nommé ?[/i]", je réponds oui. En effet, il nous faut réfléchir ("[i]to think[/i]" en anglais, pour les deux du fond qui dormaient pendant les cours) afin de venir à bout de la soixantaine de niveaux qu'il compte. Et je vous saurais gré de ne pas être désobligeants en pointant du doigt cette prononciation si délicieuse qui m'a fait amalgamer, peut-être à tort, [i]sinkr[/i] et [i]thinker[/i]. Bref. Voilà un jeu qui pousse à la réflexion sans jamais devenir frustrant, malgré l'absence de fonction permettant d'annuler nos actions. Autant dire que les chances pour que vous vous fassiez un nœud au cerveau restent plutôt maigres.

Pour autant, les une ou deux heures de jeu qu'il propose ne sont pas dénuées d'intérêt. Si son côté épuré, son ambiance relaxante et l'impression qu'il donne au premier abord lui confèrent un certain air de famille avec [i][b]Hook[/b][/i], on s'aperçoit toutefois très vite que son gameplay est différent. Ici, l'objectif est de faire glisser un ou plusieurs palets, carrés ou circulaires, jusqu'aux emplacements correspondants ; à ce détail près qu'un palet circulaire peut entrer dans un emplacement carré, mais pas l'inverse. Emplacements dans lesquels vous devrez par ailleurs envoyer un, deux ou trois palets, selon le nombre de bandes concentriques qui les constituent.

Pour ce faire, vous aurez sous la main divers outils. Tout d'abord des crochets, simples ou multiples, qui changeront de position en un clic, mais qui ne se déplacent que dans un seul sens ; à moins bien sûr que vous ne parveniez, avec un peu d'astuce, à les tracter dans l'autre. Ensuite des flèches, dont la vocation se résume à réorienter les palets, puis des téléporteurs sur lesquels sont inscrits entre un et quatre points. Pourquoi cette numérotation ? C'est très simple : pour peu qu'il existe deux portails identiques, on entre par l'un pour ressortir par l'autre. Du coup, je vous laisse deviner ce qu'il advient lorsque trois voire quatre de ces portails portent le même numéro. Enfin, dernier dispositif, un pivot qui redirige les palets, avant de tourner d'un quart de tour, dans un sens défini.

Tout ceci fonctionne donc à merveille, sans compter que chacun de ces outils - le crochet excepté - dispose d'une version alternative, version que le joueur pourra configurer à loisir et en temps réel. Par exemple, on pourra modifier la direction d'une flèche, le numéro inscrit sur tel ou tel téléporteur ou enfin le sens de rotation d'un pivot. Au final, les soixante niveaux passent presque trop vite et on se surprend à regretter qu'il n'y en ait pas eu davantage. Bon, [i]regretter[/i] est un bien grand mot, dans la mesure où son prix risque peu de vous décevoir.

[h1]Verdict : 4/5 - Très bon, une valeur sûre ![/h1]

36055270.review: Fair and entertaining game. Great value for the price.

35966145.review:
[h1]8/10[/h1]

中规中矩的一款“路线规划”益智游戏，流程大约一小时，部分关卡还是需要经过仔细思考再去触发机关。
游戏玩法大致为通过拉动翻转等行为来操作抓钩以及其他机关来将屏幕中的几何图形拖入对应形状的孔内。中期关卡抓钩数量多的时候还是具有一定难度的。后期加入了一些其他机关，但关卡设计并没有带来应有的难度提升，后期看似复杂的关卡其实反而不难。由于只有四个运动方向而且每关里图形与洞的数量是对应的，所以逆推的思路很有用。
游戏的设计风格让我想到另一款叫“Hook“的游戏。
隐藏成就的创意是小加分项。

35901355.review: SiNKR is a short but satisfying experience. Every new puzzle mechanic works together with the last, and figuring out how is so very rewarding. It's minimalist, it's methodical, and it is apparent the level of care that went into designing each puzzle.

35890047.review:
途中はまりつつも2時間弱でクリア
特に攻略なしでも行ける良い難易度です。
クリア実績以外のものが一つありますが、全クリ過程で必ず取れます。
セールじゃなくてもジュース買うより安いので、パズルゲー好きならおすすめ！

35851920.review: This game has the "a-ha" moment nailed down perfectly for me. Every puzzle seems labrynthian at first until the pieces get moved around, then a cleverness (and for me, sometimes luck) will get you through. The chilled out aesthetic definitely helps with making what some people would call stressful relaxing.

35845560.review: Very satisfying and intuitive little puzzler that'll keep your brain working for a few hours at a minimum, depending on how fast you pick up on it. Mechanics build on each other nicely bit by bit, and don't forget them, you will need to use all of them later. At the price this is an absolute steal if you're into puzzle games.

35843719.review: Very relaxing, perhaps even meditative, puzzle game. The progression of the puzzle challenges seems well paced for what I have played so far.

35834488.review: This is a really relaxing game that always makes you feel proud when you beat a puzzle. Many of the puzzles are difficult enough to warrant an "aha!" moment which won't come right away. It's also well paced. After very difficult puzzles, a new mechanic is usually introduced with a few more straightfoward puzzles to teach how the mechanic works before things get really tricky again. This keeps it from becoming frustrating even for people who are hopeless with puzzles (me). I'm still stuck on one of the last levels but I feel like I'm so close... gonna have to keep trying.

35832228.review: This is an excellent little puzzle game which leaves a lot of room for creativity in solving its puzzles. Having seen the demo, I thought it looked good, but I was honestly was not expecting to enjoy it as much as I did because I feared it would not keep my attention. I did not anticipate the simple yet clever additional mechanics that would be introduced with each set of levels. The game gives you just enough of a taste of each mechanic without beating it into the ground or becoming monotonous, yet it leaves you imagining the types of puzzles that you would be able to construct from them.

35811910.review:
I don't complete the game yet, but I wanna write the review right now.  

I always play puzzles game to avoid problems when I'm overwhelmed by them, probably I won't be able to sleep tonight but I least I will stop overthinking for a few hours and have a little of peace in my mind, I can't value this and I'm really thankful.

35809383.review:
If you find yourself here, chances are you already know whether or not this game is for you. If you like to solve increasingly tricky puzzles to ambient music, then you are certainly in the right place.

This game is fairly intuitive to understand. It introduces concepts one at a time, increasing the difficulty with each new piece after it does before introducing something new. I had a chance to see this game before, and got to level 45 before stopping to review.

It works really well if your screen has touch support, even supporting multi-touch on Windows 10 (careful there). While it does have great controller support, I recommend using mouse/touch to make things a little easier. It might be possible to improve controller support by holding a "modifier" key (one of the triggers, for example) to change what the directional pad targets when selecting. Two modifiers with two joysticks should cover all the different types (I think six "categories" would be enough). Even so, the later stages can get rather busy, so mouse/touch is strongly encouraged.

Overall, SINKR is a wonderful game worth much more than it costs. I strongly recommend picking it up and playing it. According to the developer it takes roughly an hour to complete. For under a dollar, what's to lose?

35769649.review:

35709250.review:
갈고리와 구멍.

그 유명한 Hook의 뒤를 잇는 미니멀리즘을 추구한 캐주얼 퍼즐 게임이다. 동그라미와 네모를 갈고리로 낚아채 같은 모양의 구멍에 집어넣어야 하는 단순한 방식의 게임이다. 동그라미는 네모 구멍에도 집어넣을 수 있으며, 퍼즐이 진행될수록 등장하는 장치도 다양해지고 퍼즐도 복잡해지기 때문에 어떤 갈고리를 먼저 당기고 어떤 장치를 어떻게 활용할지가 점점 중요해진다.

생긴게 무슨 전기 회로처럼 생겨서 어렵게 느껴질 법도 하지만, 차분하게 퍼즐을 들여보다보면 모두 어렵지 않게 풀릴 것이다. 보기보다 그리 어려운 게임은 아니다. 총 60개의 스테이지가 준비되있으며, 대략 2시간에서 2시간 반정도면 전부 풀 수 있을 것이다. (본인기준 1.7시간) 퍼즐 갯수가 살짝 아쉽긴 하지만, 딱 1,100원짜리 게임이 제 값은 해내는 게임이다.

역시나 가성비가 뛰어난 퍼즐 게임이다. 스팀 지갑에 애매하게 천얼마 남았을 때 구매해서 즐기기 딱 좋은 게임.

http://blog.naver.com/kitpage/221119013365

35706284.review: SiNKR is a beautifully simple puzzle game with some pretty complex setups. It's hard to think of many puzzle games that not only often has multiple solutions per level, but has solutions so set in hard logic. On top of all of this, the game has a beautifully crafted learning curve that gently guides the player into a solid understanding of each mechanic. I only hope that some more levels are added in the future through an expansion or sequel! This is more than worth the low price.

35704314.review: I enjoyed this game. Played through the whole thing and loved every minute of it! Worth every penny and then some!

35703678.review: It's a relaxing game that does a great job explaining its mechanics without even using a word, yet manages to create some decent puzzles. There's not much to it as it only has 60 puzzles, but for less than a dollar you can have some fun with it. Just don't expect a masterpiece.

35703629.review:

35703577.review:
I'm a big fan of minimalist puzzle games like this and this is one of the better ones. The puzzles haven't been too hard but do offer a little challenge. The mechanics are in some ways unique but the core is similar to other games but that isn't a bad thing. The way it is done certainly is different though. 

It would be nice to have a level editor so I hope this can be added in the future.

But the game certainly is worth £0.79/$1

35702153.review: Двадцатая идеальная игра в моём списке идеальных игр. Одобрено на 100% за два часа и даже чуть меньше.

35700403.review: I've played this at a few game cons in the Atlanta area and have enjoyed it immensely. To repeat what others have said: soothing tones, solid puzzle mechanics that build on each other and puzzles that just look unsolvable toward the end... until you get that "aha moment" and guide all the pucks into their respective places.  A must try for fans of Klocki (which I loved) and a solid release from this developer. My only criticism would be that it is too short and I am hopeful there will be an update to keep me coming back in the future.

35694816.review:
I played this game at the Southern Fried Gaming Expo this past summer and I was very impressed with it's simplicity and design.
The final product adds so much to the version I played before. SiNKR is a simplistic, calm game with a smooth art style, atmospheric music, and a meditative-like focus. I'm really enjoying figuring out all the puzzles. The difficulty has a good curve, it adds new elements at a good pace to where I didn't feel lost or overwhelmed.
Definitely give this game a try.

35686563.review: Leaves me wanting more. Good time

35683785.review:
The visuals are nice, and the use of piano to emphasize player actions enhances the already soothing sound in a subtle but powerful way. With intuitive level design, a steady introduction of new mechanics, and a strong gameplay emphasis on "show, don't tell", SiNKR is a charming puzzle game that's well worth the low price.

(I first played this at SIEGE, by the way.)

35681524.review: I saw this game at a con a while back and I really enjoyed playing it. I'm glad I am able to bring it home. It's addicting and relaxing.

35680808.review:
SiNKR is one of those puzzle games that rewards you for really thinking to get the answer, instead of attempting mindless trail and error.

The way to play is really straightforward, move the shaped orbs by moving them with hooks and simple contraptions to specified goals. And where the game shines is in the sum of all the simple mechanics put together. Bruteforcing the answer will only get you so far, as most of the moves you make are irreversible. And because of that inherent commitment for each movement I was sometimes left staring at the screen thinking what hook I should move next or where the orbs should end up at. Which makes the"oh, that is what I'm supposed to do" moment all the more satisfying.

My only pet peeve would be the fact that when making a wrong move you have to restart the puzzle again. But then again, I understand there really is no other way to punish for making a wrong move. If I was able to undo / redo endlessly the last movements, the game would swap from really thinking for an answer to mindless trail and error. 

I might have to also point out that it didn't sink right away that circles could go inside square goals, another "tutorial" for this would be nice. But once you get the hang of it, you are in for a good experience.

What should I say? It is $1 (and while you may be reading this, maybe even cheaper), it trains your brain, it is entertaining, and doesn't need a single word of dialogue to tell you what is going on. There is really no way you can go wrong for something so underpriced, just give it a shot. 

A bus ticket is more expensive than this game (that might someday get a mobile version you can play while riding that bus).

35667683.review: I'm a huge fan of puzzle games with simple mechanics that can be used in seemingly endless ways - after the intuitive tutorial section when sinkr ramps up the difficulty it's a deeply satisfying and unique game. Cool abstract look as well.

35667203.review:
Right off the bat, SiNKR immediately introduces itself with a soft musical background and piano notes.  It is quite a relaxing feeling.  The minimalistic aesthetic does a great job of transmitting what actions the player can take without being hand holding.  In fact, I don't think I saw a word of text outside of the name, but was able to quickly pick up on what each new mechanic was asking of me.

Where SiNKR shines for me, is in how the designer built puzzles around a small set of core pieces.  By combining them in interesting ways, each puzzle feels fresh and poses a new challenge, rather than repeating the same action over and over. 

Learning the mechanics actually reminds me of the way The Witness teaches the player its puzzle language.  While the scope is smaller, the experience felt very similar to me.

Highly recommended!

35663731.review: There are a few things that stand out about SiNKR — the main point being just how relaxing it is. You'll love this game if you're a legit puzzle game fan, enjoy a minimalist approach to game design, and you like figuring things out on your own with no direction. Read my full review on GameSkinny: https://www.gameskinny.com/pml9a/sinkr-review-a-soothing-minimalist-puzzle-experience

35663055.review: Amazing. Some of my favorite games (Oxyd, Cyberbox, The Incredible Machine and Lemmings) have one thing in common: They all are rule based manipulation puzzles. SiNKR is right up there with all of them. Using a deceptively simple mechanic, SiNKR provides 60 increasingly challenging puzzles to entertain you with. With each puzzle you learn something new that will then be built upon in the remaining puzzles. In addition to the challenging puzzles, they are presented in a minimalist environment with a pleasing soundtrack that dovetails well with the sounds created by the mechanic itself. There is also no hidden information, which is a technique that I prefer. On some puzzles, you can figure out the solution before making your first move. On later puzzles, you can try to do this...but I found I always overlooked one or two things and had to fail a few times before having the critical "A-Ha" moment to help me solve a particular puzzle. All in all, just a great game. I look forward to seeing what this developer comes up with next. (I want to add that I played the entire game in the final beta form just prior to launch. I spent about 2.5 hours playing it on Tuesday and Wednesday.)

39601741.review:
[h1][b]SiNKR		* 8/10[/b][/h1]

Do you feel the need for a puzzle game which is simple to play and at the same time challenge you with more and more intricated riddles? SiNKR will satisfy that need.

[h1][i]GAMEPLAY. How does SiNKR work?[/i][/h1]
Either I explain it or not, the game is extremely intuitive. It directly starts with the basics and then increases difficulty by adding new and new elements, always presenting them first, with an intuitive riddle that show how they work.

Essentially you have circles you have to drag into holes by grabbing them with hooks that moves in only one direction through a fixed pattern. That's how it starts though, because after some puzzles new mechanics and elements will be introduced, increasing the articulation and complexity of riddles.

The only input the game requires is a simple click and this added to the look of the game makes it very tablet/mobile friendly. As a matter of fact it can be found in google's playstore too, though I'm not sure it has been already released or it's going to be.

[h1][i]GRAPHIC. Engine And Artistic aspects.[/i][/h1]
Very simple, clean and essential look, no texts, only icons in menu, while in game it resembles a lot a blueprint with a blue background, a thin grey grid and all the elements white colored. Simple and pleasant.

[h1][i]SOUNDTRACK. Themes and Accompaniments.[/i][/h1]
Another good side of the game. The game is accompanied by a beautiful piano theme, but that's not all. Every action, click, or effect consists of a single piano note. Very nice and pleasant. This is the last element out of many that makes the game so relaxing and entertaining at the same time.

[h1][i]LAST NOTES. What doesn't work?[/i][/h1]
Not much. Except that it's short. But it's cheap too, so you get what you pay for.

[h1][i]TL;DR. Pros And Cons[/i][/h1]
[h1]+++PROs+++[/h1][list]
[*][b] ALL.[/b] A challenging puzzle game, with an extremely intuitive gameplay, an increasing difficulty level and a pleasant music. That's all you can ask for a puzzle game. Its ease of use makes the game very tablet/mobile friendly and some kind of early access version seems to be available in Google's play store.
[/list]
[h1]---CONs---[/h1][list]
[*][b] SHORT.[/b] The game has 60 puzzles but I've completed them in two hours.
[/list]

[i]I played this game on this machine:
Laptop Lenovo Z50
Intel Core i5-4210U
8Gb RAM DDR3
GeForce 840M/Intel HD Graphics 4400
Windows 10 Home x64[/i]

39562011.review: Na kanwie wysypu rozmaitych prostych gierek logicznych znanych jako "minimalistic puzzle games", zaopatrzyłem się w kolejny produkt o nazwie SiNKR. Jest to zupełnie coś nowego, coś niepodobnego do gier, z jakimi miałem dotychczas do czynienia. Może poza prostotą i szybkim zrozumieniem zasad, chociaż w samej gierce trzeba trochę pogłówkować. No, ale po to jest w końcu mózg, aby go używać, zaś sam poziom trudności nie jest jakiś przesadzony, aby dał sobie z nim radę przeciętny dziewięcio-, a nawet siedmiolatek. W skrócie, za pomocą haków musimy wprowadzić wszystkie piłeczki (na kolejnym poziomach są w różnych odmianach) do dziur. Jako, że jeden otwór  może przyjąć tylko jedną piłeczkę, musimy ostro główkować, jak rozplanować swoją rozgrywkę. W trakcie bowiem gry poziomy są coraz bardziej skomplikowane, a dochodzi nam coraz więcej zależności i trików typu przeciąganie haków, teleporty, przenoszenie piłeczek i innych uprzyjemniaczy. Na pocieszenie dodam, że w grze nie liczy się refleks jak to jest na przykład w ZuP-ach i możemy na spokojnie obmyślać strategię. Poziomów jest 60 i co jakiś czas jesteśmy nagradzani osiągnięciem na Steamie, których niestety jest tylko 10. Grafika miła i stonowana, stworzona na styl amerykańskich planów zwanych "blueprintami", z powodu ciemnoniebieskiego tła. Muzykę standardowo wyłączyłem, ot jakaś ambientowa przygrywajka. Gra w cenie 99 eurocentów, a zabawy na 2-3 godziny. Kart nie ma, ale może będą. Osobiście polecam miłośnikom perfekcyjnego zaliczania gier, no i naturalnie samego grania w podobne tytuły. Na koniec dodam, że twórca wykazał się swoistym poczuciem humoru, informując że gra obsługuje aż 27 języków, zarówno w interfejsie, udźwiękowieniu jak i napisach. Jest to o tyle ciekawe, bo w całej grze nie usłyszymy ani jednego napisu, ani nie przeczytamy ani jednego dźwięku (czy jakoś tak ;).

39611215.review:
Un bon petit jeu de réflexion, qui permet de se détendre tranquillement sans trop de prise de tête.
Le principe est simple, acheminer à l'aide de crochets des palets ronds ou carrés dans leurs emplacements définis. A cela s'ajoutent plusieurs outils, comme des téléporteurs ou des flèches directionnelles, ou encore des astuces, comme aggriper deux crochets ensemble pour pouvoir aller dans les deux sens.
La durée de vie de ce jeu, à mon avis, n'excède pas les 2-3h mais compte tenu du prix, on ne va pas trop lui en tenir rigueur. 
En bref, un bon moyen de passer le temps de façon agréable et en utilisant un peu ses méninges tout de même, que du positif, je recommande !

Anyway.
This game is not what you want to play if you want to have fun or relax.
I've wasted enough time and money on it already.

I won't ask for a refund so that you don't need to buy it and developer still gets what he wanted.
Now go play something nice.

39977328.review: It'a very good for a 0,99€ puzzle game because it has many levels (60) and it's getting harder and harder level by level. Just "!!!THE BEST!!!". Totally worth the money...

39934105.review:
[u]In short[/u] this is a smart and solid puzzle game introducing some fresh and innovative ideas to the genre. It is rather short and I do have some minor gripes with it, but the price is adequate and I enjoyed myself. As long as you don't expect a minimalist puzzle masterpiece I can wholeheartedly recommend this game.

[u]In long[/u]: The basic premise is as simple as it gets: Use hooks to drag pellets into holes. You reel in hooks by holding down large hexagonal buttons, which feels awkward. Some levels depend on very precise sequences and holding a mouse button and releasing it with the right timing didn't feel like intuitive [b][u]controls[/u][/b]. Thankfully everything happens on a grid and a single click advances the hook by a fixed amount, so I mostly ended up clicking my way through the game.
There is a total of 60 levels and roughly every 6 levels a new [b][u]mechanic[/u][/b] is introduced. These turned out to be surprisingly interesting and some of them give you a lot of freedom in approaching levels as you can set up holding loops and redirect portals for instance. I didn't mind that a few levels required timing, as the windows were pretty generous. There definitely is some interesting and innovative stuff happening here and providing a good amount of variety, but some interactions are a bit wonky. I've never figured out how to reliably tell which of two overlapping hooks would grab a pellet, and it can get pretty hard to click the right thing in a crowded area, but thankfully those drawbacks very rarely come up.
All these mechanics are very gently introduced, which on the flipside means there's at least 2 very easy tutorial stages every ~6 levels and as such the [b][u]difficulty[/u][/b] is more like a rollercoaster than a progression. The levels are arranged in blocks by the spotlighted mechanic and only some of the new features are kept for later stages. Sometimes it feels like once you've become familiar with a new mechanic the game already moves on - more like a proof of concept rather than a game. There definitely is no filler levels to be found here. Still, there are some decently challenging levels where you do have to plan ahead instead of mindlessly brute-forcing your way through it. This is further encouraged by the complete lack of an undo mechanic. The game is still very much approachable, but not completely casual. Those harder levels are where much of my enjoyment of the game came from. Still, without much of a rush, I completed all 60 levels in just 75 minutes. I would have enjoyed a little more content, but I can also see myself going back to SiNKR in a few years.

Visually the game looks fine. The [b][u]graphics[/u][/b] and animations are pretty simple, but I wouldn't go so far as call them minimalist (per the stated design intention on the store page) and it's certainly not a clean aesthetic. The screen actually felt pretty crowded with the background grid lighting up and pellets in hooks having yellow stripes and the many elements of the larger levels. And I really didn't like the graphical effect upon resetting a level - to me it always felt out of place and jarring. The [b][u]sounds[/u][/b] are pretty good and the music is non-intrusive enough that I only turned it down, not off (which I usually do in puzzle games).

On the [b][u]technical[/u][/b] side, the game launched in a weird low resolution 4:3 in full screen. Due to the buttons and options being a bit cryptic (minimalist aesthetic is fine, but a few tool-tips would go a long way) it took a bit to figure out, but in the end all the customizations I wanted worked (windowed mode, resolution, volume sliders). The initial loading time feels a bit long and if you click during it you can cause the loading screen to freeze/break (only visually). Other than that I never encountered any technical problems or glitches.

I can't say I was blown away by SiNKR, but it did have some neat ideas showing innovation and potential for a more fleshed-out game down the road. It's a solid puzzle game that to me feels entirely adequately priced for its short length. I did enjoy my time with it and can recommend you pick it up if puzzle games interest you.

39919264.review:
SiNKR is a brief but entertaining puzzle game.
 
Each level feels well designed and the solutions feel very intuitive to find. The game utilizes a minimalistic visual design with ambient sound effects and music not unlike various other puzzle games found on Steam. However, I found that the sound design was not as well executed as other puzzle games of similar minimalistic styles that I have played.

As you progress though the levels, more puzzle elements are introduced, which adds to the challenge and variety. However, the game overall is relatively easy, and at times there does not seem to be a distinct difficulty curve, as the difficulty seems to vary from one puzzle to the next. SiNKR also only features 60 levels, making for a very short game which I was able to complete in less than 2 hours. Although, given the very inexpensive price of the game, its length is a minor issue.

Overall, I found SiNKR to be an enjoyable, relaxing puzzle game.
